features: EXPERT-LEVEL SMOOTH – Hydro Silk Shave Cream & 24-Hour Moisturizer gives you expert-level care at home for your pubic area and body.
2-in-1 FORMULA – Formulated with aloe and shea butter, use as a shave cream that softens hair to help prevent pulling while shaving and as a post-shave moisturizer.
24-HOUR MOISTURIZER – Simply rub the shave cream in and don’t worry about rinsing, your skin will feel moisturized for 24-hours.
DERMATOLOGIST TESTED – This shaving cream for pubic area is safe for your bikini area as well as your body, helping to prevent redness, irritation and itching.
WATER LILY SCENT – This women’s shaving cream leaves your skin with a refreshing and delicate water lily scent.
DYNAMIC DUO – Hydro Silk shaving cream pairs perfectly with Hydro Silk Ultimate Pubic Skin Protection Disposable Razor.
body.description: Indulge in the richness of shea butter plus aloe with our 2-in-1 shaving cream & 24-Hour Moisturizer. Schick Hydro Silk Shave Cream & 24-Hour Moisturizer provides expert-level care at home that is safe for your pubic area and softens hair to help prevent pulling while shaving. This bikini area moisturizer is formulated with aloe and shea butter, and can be used as a shave cream and a post-shave 24-hour moisturizer. Simply rub it in and don’t worry about rinsing—it leaves your skin with a refreshing and delicate water lily scent. Hydro Silk shaving cream is dermatologist tested, helping to prevent redness, irritation and itching. Get expert-level precision, control and care that’s safe for your bikini area, and pairs perfectly with Hydro Silk Ultimate Pubic Skin Protection Disposable Razor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best for coarser hair
reviews.reviewText: Before this Schick Hydro Silk shave cream, I'd never tried a shaving cream that wasn't the foaming type, and I was concerned it wouldn't work as well as my preferred brand (Satin Care Sensitive). I was also worried I'd react to the scent, either dermatologically or with my sinuses, since I tend to be sensitive to fragrances.I'm pleased to say the Water Lily scent is light, pretty, and not overly perfumey or floral, and I had no reactions at all to any part of the cream. In fact, it left my skin softer than it typically does after shaving AND adding lotion. I definitely like that!As far as how it worked, I discovered that 1) a little bit actually goes a long way, even though it doesn't seem like it will, and 2) the coarser the hair, the better the benefit. By this, I mean that the cream didn't do as good of a job on my legs as my usual foaming choice. It worked better on my armpits, equal to, if not slightly smoother than, the shave I get with my typical shaving cream, though my underarm skin felt much softer after shaving with the Schick. But the bikini area is where this cream truly shined (which makes sense since the advertising makes it seem as if that's what it's designed for). I've never achieved as smooth a shave as fast as I did with this cream—and this was using my standard razor, not a special one designed for bikini shaving—all with no irritation, abrasions, or stray escapees.I'm seriously impressed and will definitely be adding this to my bathroom staples list.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A little goes a long way
reviews.reviewText: You don't need a lot of this shaving cream to get the job done, a little does go a long way. I used this with a 6 blade razor and my legs have never felt smoother. Also used this on more corse hair to see if I'd have issues with ingrown hairs, happy to report the ingrown hairs were very minimal. As for moisturizing, my legs felt smoother after using and I didn't have to use as much lotion as I normally would.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Leave-on shave cream - very moisturizing
reviews.reviewText: This is a very moisturizing shave cream - definitely more so than the shaving foam I usually use. It enables you to get a very close shave, and definitely protects your legs from any abrasion from the razor. The directions recommend rubbing any unused foam into your skin after shaving, so it really does act as a moisturizer.The consistency is very dense and rich. It reminds me of a 40% shea butter hand cream or similar. I like that the aloe vera and shea butter make it very gentle on the skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is great for shaving. It’s moisturizing and makes the razor glide over like butter, especially on corse hair. It is moisturizing and didn’t leave my skin dry afterwards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Preps for a Comfortable Shave
reviews.reviewText: Pair this with the Schick Hydro Silk Ultimate for a comfortable shave. It lathers on well and provides a good amount of moisturization to protect and heal the skin afterwards. I would not hesitate to purchase this again in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars bye-bye flaky legs
reviews.reviewText: My skin is very sensitive and dry, especially after I shave. The Schick Hydro Silk shave cream is thick and luxurious. I applied it to my legs before shaving and when I got out of the shower and toweled off, my legs were not their usual dry and flaky. They were smooth and hydrated! I didn’t realize a good shaving cream could work such wizardry. The cream feels good on the skin and your razor glides over it. It has a subtle smell that is pleasant. My sensitive skin was not irritated at all. I’m going to need a tub of this stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great for shaving, okay for moisturizing
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this for about a month, and I've specifically tested it with lower-quality disposable razors and forgoing my usual post-shower lotioning. I will admit that it is nice and creamy and helps create a smooth shave. The smell isn't overpowering, and I didn't suffer from any nicks or bumps. As a shaving cream, it's really nice.All that being said, I'm not wholly on board with the moisturizing claims. I've used it as directed to the best of my ability, but it doesn't seem to moisturize as effectively as simply taking the extra step to slather on some standard lotion after you dry off. Plus, drying off takes a little more time and is slightly more awkward because you don't want your towel to wipe any of the product off.Overall, it's a decent product if you're just looking for a shaving cream, but if you're looking for a moisturizer, just stick to regular lotion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Its has a nice constancy
reviews.reviewText: This shaving cream has a nice constancy which is a combination of a cream and gel from what I could tell. The fragrance its also nice as it worked with the overall feel of the product. From my point of few it could have been a bit more soft overall but it still worked out nicely. I used it in combination with a Schick hydro razor and it got the job done for me.
